item.title: Clustering
item.description: Overview Clustering algorithms are unsupervised ML models which do not require labeled training data to learn classes, a key difference to [[classification]] algorithms. Algorithms [[K-means Clustering]] [[Hierarchical Clustering]] [[Affinity Propogation Clustering]] #investigate [[Mean-Shift Clustering]] #investigate [[Spectral Clustering]] #investigate Evaluation Silhouette Score: Lower is better

item.title: data science
data science/glossary
item.description: {{query (and [[term]] [[ds]])}} query-table:: true query-properties:: [:term :tags :definition] term:: [[EDA]] tags:: [[ds]] definition:: Exploratory Data Analysis refers to the process of familarization and discovery of the defining characteristics of a dataset. EDA is the first step in any data science venture and is critical in uncovering data quality concerns, empirical statistical structure, and more. Broadly, EDA involves visualizing data from several perspectives such as scatter plots between variables, box-and-whisker plots, histograms, run charts, bar charts, etc.

item.title: data visualization
item.description: [[plots for visualizing data]] Doughnut Chart In my opinion, a far better version of a pie chart A doughnut (or donut) chart is a pie chart with a “hole” - a blank circular area in the center. The chart is divided into parts that show the percentage each value contributes to a total. Like the regular pie chart, the doughnut chart is used with small sets of data to compare categories.

item.title: Interview Cheatsheet
item.description: Math/Statistics :PROPERTIES: :heading: true :collapsed: true :END: Probability vs. Likelihood Probability: During the testing phase, given a learned model, we determine the probability of observing the outcome Likelihood: During training, given some outcome we determine the likelihood of observing theta that maximizes the probability of that outcome (MLE). Bayes Theorem Revise prediction using new evidence Naive Bayes Classifier: Generative Classification model Linear Transformation $f(\alpha x + \beta y)=\alpha f(x)+\beta f(y)$
